topic.title: How to Setup a Load-Balanced Server

keywords.indexterm: Web Author Administration page load balancing

body.p: To scale a deployment to a larger number of users and to increase the availability, can be deployed on a set of load-balanced servers. This topic describes the required setup for such a scenario.

section.title: Configure Session Stickyness
section.p: Every server keeps the state of the edited documents in memory for performance reasons. This implies that every user should connect to the same back-end server for the duration of an editing session. To achieve this result in a load-balanced setting, you should enable session stickyness.

body.section:
Configure Server Health ChecksTo detect unhealthy servers, offers a health check REST API. The endpoint has the following interface:
URL rest-public/status
Response status code 200 for a healthy server and 503 for an unhealthy server.
Response body For an unhealthy server, the response body contains a text description of the problem.

section.title: Configure the License Server
section.p: All servers can use the same pool of floating licenses. To this end, they all need to be configured to use the same license server.

section.title: Share options between all instances
section.p: The configuration options are stored in the file system in a directory that can be changed using the oxygen.data.dir system property. In order for all instances to use the same options, oxygen.data.dir should point to the same directory on a shared file system.
